title: Video games in China
content: The video game industry in Mainland China currently is one of the major markets for the global video game industry, where more than half a billion people play video games. Revenues from China make up around 25% of nearly US$100 billion video game industry as of 2018, and since 2015 has exceeded the contribution to the global market from the United States.[2] Because of its market size, China has been described as the "Games Industry Capital of the World" and is home to some of the largest video game companies.[3] China has also been a major factor in the growth of esports, both in player talent and in revenue.
